summary: Cell-phone cameras have their roots in a federal lab—thanks to laws encouraging commercial use of federal inventions. The federal government spends about $137 billion a year researching and developing inventions. The government can license the patents on these inventions to private companies to further develop and bring the technologies to market. Federal agencies and labs said that identifying patentable inventions was difficult, with some citing...
title: Federal Research: Additional Actions Needed to Improve Licensing of Patented Laboratory Inventions
